items.headline: Bud Light’s struggling. Now its owner is reportedly buying a punch maker.
items.summary_en: Anheuser-Busch InBev , one of the world’s largest beer companies and owner of brands like Budweiser, Stella Artois and Michelob, is reportedly in talks to buy BeatBox, a manufacturer of boxed, wine-based punch, for around $700 million.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘My retirement is completely in bitcoin’: Why don’t more people do what I do?

items.headline: Meta’s stock has been under heavy pressure. Now the company is undergoing a shakeup.

items.headline: Why it’s not too late to buy Alphabet’s stock, according to the newest Google bull
items.summary_en: Alphabet’s stock has already doubled off its 2025 lows, but an analyst is still upbeat about Google’s resilience in search and its growing presence in semiconductors.

items.headline: Callaway Golf is selling off most of Topgolf on the cheap — and ditching the name
items.summary_en: The Callaway golf company is selling off 60% of its stake in its Topgolf business at a significantly discounted valuation, and changing its name back to what it was before the business was purchased.

items.headline: Nio’s stock suffers longest losing streak in nearly two years as earnings pressure builds
items.summary_en: Nio reports third-quarter results next week. After that the company will be in the hot seat, as it’s set out to reach profitability by the fourth quarter.
